The following concerns were noted at the exterior trim:
Peeling paint at the fascia under the right side of the balcony. 
Separating seams in the soffit in several areas. 
Delamination at the soffit at the rear of the house. 
Gap in the garage door header trim. 
Opening in the soffit at the generator conduit. 
Moisture damaged corner wall trim at the rear of the house. Recommend repairing/replacing.

Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the exterior walls:
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected in all exterior surfaces as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes. 
Recommend caulking/sealing intersections between dissimilar building materials.
Staining on the stucco at the front walls above the dining room window. 
Cracked stucco under the front right bedroom window and at the right side wall.  
Significant cracks were noted in the brick above the garage door. 
Chipped hardie siding at the rear of the house. Recommend repairing/replacing.

Accessible windows were inspected.  Windows as a grouping are generally operational and appear serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.
The following concerns were noted at the windows:
Upstairs front bedroom, dining room, and master bedroom windows appear to be leaking. 
Casement windows are painted shut. 
Security system sensors appear to have been installed through the bottom of the window framing. This may allow water intrusion and may void any remaining manufacturer's warranty. Recommend regular cleaning of the bottom tracks of the window to allow proper water drainage and monitoring for future problems.
